title: Gesture-Based Interactions
excerpt: Designing intuitive touch and motion-based interactions.
content:
Gesture-based interactions have become a fundamental part of mobile and touch-based interfaces. They allow users to interact with applications in a more natural and intuitive way, enhancing the overall user experience.

Common Gestures

  • Tap: Basic selection or activation
  • Double Tap: Zoom or quick action
  • Long Press: Contextual menus or additional options
  • Swipe: Navigation or dismissal
  • Pinch/Spread: Zoom in/out

Best Practices

  1. Use familiar gestures that users already know
  2. Provide visual feedback for gestures
  3. Ensure gestures are discoverable or have visible alternatives
  4. Consider accessibility for users who may have difficulty with certain gestures
  5. Test gestures on various device sizes and orientations
